description: Plutonium is a highly radioactive metal central to nuclear energy and weapons technology. It forms multiple allotropes, each with distinct physical properties, complicating its use and storage. Plutonium-239 is especially important for sustaining nuclear reactions. Strict safety and security measures govern all handling and transport due to its long-term radioactivity. Beyond reactors, plutonium powers some deep-space missions through radioisotope generators. Its behavior in the environment is closely monitored to prevent contamination. While its history is controversial, plutonium remains a crucial material for both energy research and space exploration, demonstrating the dual-use nature of advanced nuclear technology.
name: Plutonium
